Comments_List: basics of BLM and eddy covariance
I got a good understanding of the fundamentals of this subfield.
Greatly broadened my knowledge/understanding of boundary layer meteorology and many relevant applications.

I gained knowledge in the properties of the boundary layer, and principles that govern the meteorology in that layer. I also learned mathematical approaches to deal with the numerical analysis, as well as basic knowledge of field measurement.
Knowledge about basic processes and evolution in the boundary layer, surface heat budget, basics about turbulence and footprint. Also some practical measurement skills.
I learned much more than I expected.
They aligned wel, and I found the class useful and will certainly be able to use what I have learned in the future.
The knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class was beyond my expectations.
Very engaging, hands-on, and was nice to produce something so practical (the answer key)
Wel-taught, organized, and homework assignments were pertinent and useful. An online discussion for questions on homework could be useful.
The course offers advanced knowledge of meteorology. The topics covered are very helpful.
This course covered all that I would expect to learn from an introductory boundary layer meteorology course.

The class gives a very good, fairy challenging coverage of boundary layer meteorology. It's definitely important to keep up with readings, ask questions, and start homework early, but everything is manageable and worthwhile.
Have some basic knowledge on fluid dynamics and atmospheric radiation would be helpful.
